DOC.brief_summary: The aorta is a large blood vessel that carries blood away from the heart to the organs in the rest of the body. An aneurysm is a weakening in the artery wall that will become a bulge in the aorta. If left untreated, this bulge may continue to grow larger and may rupture (break open) with fatal consequences. Abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) is a life-threatening lesion that has been treated in recent year via endovascular repair. The purpose of this study is to monitor the long term performance of the AneuRx Stent Graft Systems.
DOC.brief_title: AneuRx Post Market Study in the Treatment of AAA
DOC.criteria: Patients implanted with an AneuRx Stent Graft per Instructions for Use Patients must provide written informed consent and agree to be accessible for followup at the study center.
